Reviews.Content: we liked We spent 3 nights at Taman Sari bali and 1 night at Pondok Sari and we definitively preferred Pondok Sari. The room was clear, well furnished, the breakfast was quite good
Reviews.Author: mclBrussels

Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here If you're used to staying at a nice resort, do not stay here. There are no locks on the doors and the area doesn't seem to be the nicest. I would definitely stay at one of the major resorts if you're looking for great food, great service, etc.
Reviews.Author: casademurphy

Reviews.Content: Wonderful German efficiency When we walked into this beach hotel, we tried but failed to negotiate the room rate down. When we saw the room (in semi-detached bungalow) and the hotel facilities, coupled with the fact it is German owned and very well run, we thought it was well worth the 50 Euros/night. The Pondok Sari is set in jungle type gardens, with lilly ponds, a swimming pool, a spa (choice of massages) , a bar and restaurant with views to the beach and ocean. The rooms were large, with mosquito net, daily fresh flowers and a wonderful outdoor bathroom. The quality, variety and size of the breakfasts were amazing. Great snorkelling and diving trips leave daily from the hotel. We can hardly think of anything negative - ok, we could hear our neighbours' voices and their early morning alarm in the room next to us. The hotel is one of a small number built amongst the original village of Pemuteran and all the villagers we met on our walks along the beach and the local roads were extremely friendly. It was such a lovely place that we stayed five days - twice as long as we intended.
Reviews.Author: Englishtravelfanatic
